sen.j: 藤原楓麻呂（ふじわら の かえでまろ、養老7年（723年）- 宝亀7年6月13日 (旧暦)（776年8月5日））は、奈良時代の官僚。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kaedemaro (723 – August 5, 776) was a bureaucracy in the Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Kaedemaro (723 – July 7, 776) was a bureaucracy in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 「宝亀7年6月13日」をグレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Kaedemaro (723 – July 7, 776) was a bureaucracy in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 名は楓麿あるいは楓万呂とも表記することもある。
sen.e: His name Kaedemaro楓麻呂 was also written as 楓麿 or 楓万呂 (the pronunciations were the same).
His name Kaedemaro 楓麻呂 was also written as 楓麿 or 楓万呂 (the pronunciations are same).
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: His name Kaedemaro 楓麻呂 was also written as 楓麿 or 楓万呂 (the pronunciations are same).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was the seventh son of Sangi (councilor) FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
He was the seventh son of Sangi (councilor) FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was the seventh son of Sangi (councilor) FUJIWARA no Fusasaki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His last rank and post was Jusanmi Sangi (councilor at junior third rank).
Ranked Jusanmi Sangi (councilor at junior third court rank).
sen.cmt: 主語を省略しました。
sen.e: Ranked Jusanmi Sangi (councilor at Junior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: junior third court rank→Junior Third Rank統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 758年（天平宝字2年）西海道問民苦使に任じられ、その地で病気で苦しんでいることを太政官に報告し、大宰府がそれに対処している。
sen.e: In 758, he was appointed to Saikaido Monminkushi (investigator for the common people of Saikai-do Road); he reported about the disease spread in the region to Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) dealt with that.

In 758, he was appointed to Saikaido Monminkushi (investigator for the common people of Saikai-do Road); he reported about the disease spread in the region to Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) dealt with that.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 758, he was appointed to Saikaido Monminkushi (investigator for the common people of Saikai-do Road); he reported about the disease spread in the region to Daijokan (Grand Council of State) and Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) dealt with that.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年8月従五位下に叙せられ、9月に民の疾苦29件を上申した。
sen.e: In August of the same year, he was raised to Jugoinoge (junior fifth rank, lower grade), and in September, he again reported twenty-nine issues he had found in the common people.
In August of the same year, he was raised to Jugoinoge (junior fifth rank, lower grade), and in September he again reported twenty-nine issues of disease spread among common people.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ「疾苦」を補足しました。
sen.e: In August of the same year, he was raised to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, lower grade), and in September he again reported twenty-nine issues of disease spread among common people.
sen.cmt: junior fifth rank,→Junior Fifth Rank統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 更に天平宝字4年正月、式部省で東海道巡察使になる。
sen.e: In January, 760, he was appointed to Tokaido Junsatsushi (circuit inspector of Tokai-do Road) and belonged to Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Personnel).
In January, 760, he was appointed to Tokaido Junsatsushi (circuit inspector of Tokai-do Road) and belonged to Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Personnel).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In January, 760, he was appointed to Tokaido Junsatsushi (circuit inspector of Tokai-do Road) and belonged to Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Personnel).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天平宝字8年9月、藤原仲麻呂の乱が勃発すると追討に当たり、乱終結後の同年10月美濃国守に任ぜられた。
sen.e: In September, 764, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro launched a war (Fujiwara no Nakamaro no Ran), Kaedemaro was dispatched to subdue it; after the war, in October of the same year, he was appointed to Mino-no-kuni no Kami (governor of Mino Province).

He huntd down and subdued FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War which launched in October, 764, and after the war, in November of the same year, he was appointed to Mino-no-kuni no Kami (Governor of Mino Province).
sen.cmt: 「天平宝字8年9月」「同年10月」をグレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: He huntd down and subdued FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War which launched in October, 764, and after the war, in November of the same year, he was appointed to Mino-no-kuni no Kami (Governor of Mino Province).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天平神護元年（765年）正月に勲等を賜った。
sen.e: In January, 765, he was given a medal for his merit.
In February, 765, he was given a medal for his merit.
sen.cmt: 「天平神護元年（765年）正月」をグレゴリを暦に変更しました。
sen.e: In February, 765, he was given a medal for his merit.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年7月兵衛府に任ぜられ、以後大宰大弐、弁官、信濃国守などを歴任した。
sen.e: Since July of the same year, he served at Hyoe-fu (Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards); after that, he held important posts such as Dazai no Daini (senior assistant of governor general of Dazai-fu), Benkan (Otomoi no Tsukasa or an official of the oversight department), Shinano-no-kuni no Kami (governor of Shinano Province); in August, 770, at Taimo no Rei (the Rites of the Imperial Funeral) for Emperor Shotoku, he became Goshozoku-shi (Goshozoku no Tsukasa or an official in charge of important rituals) as well as Danjo (inspector) of Danjodai (Board of Censors) to send Priest Dokyo, who had behaved very high-mindedly in the period of Emperor Shotoku, off to Shimotsuke Province.

After he was appointed to Hyoe-fu (Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards) in July of the same year, he held important posts, such as Dazai no Daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of Dazai-fu), Benkan (Otomoi no Tsukasa or the controller of the Oversight Department), and Shinano-no-kuni no Kami (Governor of Shinano Province).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 （2分割に伴い、修正しました。）
sen.e: After he was appointed to Hyoe-fu (Headquarters of the Middle Palace Guards) in July of the same year, he held important posts, such as Dazai no Daini (Senior Assistant Governor General of Dazai-fu), Benkan (Otomoi no Tsukasa or the controller of the Oversight Department), and Shinano-no-kuni no Kami (Governor of Shinano Province).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 神護景雲4年（770年）8月、従四位下で称徳天皇の大喪の礼の御装束司を務める一方、弾正台として道鏡の下野国下向を促す任をも果たした。
sen.e: While managing Taimo no Rei (the Rites of the Imperial Funeral) for Emperor Shotoku as Goshozoku-shi (Goshozoku no Tsukasa or an official in charge of important rituals) ranked Jushiinoge (Junior forth court rank, lower level) in August, 770, he acted his part as Danjo (inspector) of Danjodai (Board of Censors) to urge Dokyo to leave the capital to Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 （2分割に伴い、修正しました。）訳漏れ「下向を促す」を補足しました。
sen.e: While managing Taimo no Rei (the Rites of the Imperial Funeral) for Emperor Shotoku as Goshozoku-shi (Goshozoku no Tsukasa or an official in charge of important rituals) ranked Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in August, 770, he acted his part as Danjo (inspector) of Danjodai (Board of Censors) to urge Dokyo to leave the capital to Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: Junior forth court rank, lower level→Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 同年同月伊勢国守になり、同年10月従四位上に昇叙された。
sen.e: Within July of the same year, he was appointed to Ise-no-kuni no Kami (governor of Ise Province) and raised to Jushiinojo (junior forth rank, upper grade).
In August, 770, he was appointed to Ise-no-kuni no Kami (Governor of Ise Province) and raised to Jushiinojo (junior forth court rank, upper grade) in October.
sen.cmt: 「同年同月」を変更し、訳漏れの「同年10月」を訳出しました。
sen.e: In August, 770, he was appointed to Ise-no-kuni no Kami (Governor of Ise Province) and raised to Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in October.
sen.cmt: junior forth court rank, upper grade→Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 宝亀2年（771年）5月、衛門府で讃岐国守を兼官し、同年11月正四位下に叙せられ、772年（宝亀3年）参議に任じられ、774年（宝亀5年）には従三位に叙せられた。
sen.e: In May, 771, he served at Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and also appointed to Sanuki-no-kuni no Kami (governor of Sanuki Province); in November of the same year, he was raised to Shoshiinoge (senior forth rank, lower grade); in 772, he was appointed to Sangi (councilor), and in 774, at last raised to Jusanmi (junior third rank).

In June, 771, he served at Emonfu (Headquarters of the Outer Palace Guards) and also appointed to Sanuki-no-kuni no Kami (Governor of Sanuki Province), in December of the same year, he was raised to Shoshiinoge (senior forth court rank, lower grade), in 772 he was appointed to Sangi (Councilor), and at last he raised to Jusanmi (junior third rank) in 774.
sen.cmt: 「宝亀2年5月」「同年11月」をグレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 宝亀6年11月大蔵卿で摂津国を兼任したが、宝亀7年6月13日薨去。
sen.e: In November, 775, he was appointed to Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury) as well as Settsu-no-kuni no Kami (governor of Settsu Province); on August 5, 776, he died.
In December, 775, he additionally served as Settsu-no-kuni no Kami (governor of Settsu Province) while Okura-kyo (Minister of the Treasury); on July 7, 776, he died.
sen.cmt: 「宝亀6年11月」「宝亀7年6月13日」をグレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
